result.execSummary:
The defendant Nicholas A. Matoska was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Retail Theft - Intentionally Take >$500 - $5000), a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.50(1m)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: BOND APPLIED - fine pd in full.
6 months to pay or contempt of court.

Minutes:  15CF529/15CF1114.  Clerk/T. Lehman.  ADA Krejcarek appeared for the State.  Deft appeared in person w/Atty Rocco DeFilippis.  Victim rights compliance.  Sentencing arguments made.

15CF529 - deft fined $800 plus costs.  Bond from both files to be applied.  Balance to be applied to fines in 15CF1114.  Restitution of $576.39 ordered to Walmart; 6mos to pay restitution.  Failure to pay restitution may result in contempt proceedings.

15CF1114 - deft fined $100 plus costs on all four counts.  Bond to be applied.  Balance due in 30 days.  In default, 12 days work crew or 12 days KCJ on each count.  Restitution of $935 ordered; 6mos to pay restitution.  Failure to pay restitution may result in contempt proceedings.

Credit for 5 days.

15CF529 - deft pleads guilty; found guilty by the Court.
